com.advantage.reporting

Class Screenshot

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.advantage.reporting.Screenshot

  • public class Screenshot
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is for taking screenshots.

    Note: The screenshots will be blank if running in a minimized Terminal Services window. However, other windows can overlay this window.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Screenshot() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean bCheckCreateScreenshotFolder()
      This function will check & create the screenshot folder(s) as necessary.

      Note: If you do not know or cannot guarantee that the screenshot folder will exist, then use this function before creating any screenshots.
      static void disableAllowScreenshots()
      Disable screenshots from being taken
      static void enableAllowScreenshots()
      Allow screenshots to be taken
      static boolean getAllowScreenshotsStatus()
      Method to allow to get screenshot status
      static java.lang.String getCounter(int nCounter, int nTotalLength)
      Creates a string with leading zeros (if necessary) to make specified total length.
      static java.lang.String getNewLine()
      Method to get Newline
      static java.lang.String getPathSeparator()
      Method to get path separator
      static int getScreenshotCounter()
      Method to get screeenshot counter
      static void resetScreenshotCounter()
      Resets the nScreenshotCounter back to initial value of 1
      static java.lang.String saveErrorScreenshot()
      Saves unique screenshot to following location with name: sScreenshotFolder + PathSeparator + sScreenshotPrefixName + nScreenshotCounter + "_" + sSuffix + ".png" Example: c:\\temp\\screenshot001_login.png
      static boolean saveScreenshot()
      Saves unique screenshot to following location with name: sScreenshotFolder + PathSeparator + sScreenshotPrefixName + nScreenshotCounter + ".png" Example: c:\\temp\\screenshot001.png
      static boolean saveScreenshot(java.lang.String sFilename)
      Saves screenshot.
      static boolean saveScreenshot(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
      Saves unique screenshot to following location with name: sScreenshotFolder + PathSeparator + sScreenshotPrefixName + nScreenshotCounter + ".png"

      Note:
      1) Must use this method if using Grid
      2) If driver cannot be cast to TakesScreenshot, no screenshot will be taken
      3) It is possible for the screenshot to be blank
      4) There seems to be an issue with Firefox on certain platforms that prevents screenshots from being taken.

      Example:
      saveScreenshot(driver) => c:\\temp\\screenshot001.png
      static boolean saveScreenshot(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, java.lang.String sFilename)
      Saves screenshot.
      static boolean saveScreenshotAddSuffix(java.lang.String sSuffix)
      Saves unique screenshot to following location with name: sScreenshotFolder + PathSeparator + sScreenshotPrefixName + nScreenshotCounter + "_" + sSuffix + ".png" Example: c:\\temp\\screenshot001_login.png

      Method to set Newline

      static void setScreenshotCounter(int nValue)
      Allows you to change nScreenshotCounter to any value.

      Note: This is not recommended and it is unnecessary.
      static void setScreenshotSettings(java.lang.String sScreenshotFolder, java.lang.String sScreenshotPrefixName)

      • saveScreenshot

        public static boolean saveScreenshot()
        Saves unique screenshot to following location with name: sScreenshotFolder + PathSeparator + sScreenshotPrefixName + nScreenshotCounter + ".png" Example: c:\\temp\\screenshot001.png
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        nTotalLength - - size of string
        Returns:

      • bCheckCreateScreenshotFolder

        public static boolean bCheckCreateScreenshotFolder()
        This function will check & create the screenshot folder(s) as necessary.

        Note: If you do not know or cannot guarantee that the screenshot folder will exist, then use this function before creating any screenshots.
        Returns:
        true if the screenshot folder exists after execution else false

      • saveScreenshot

        public static boolean saveScreenshot(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                     java.lang.String sFilename)
        Saves screenshot. (User needs to ensure file is unique and it is has a PNG extension)

        Notes:
        1) Must use this method if using Grid
        2) If driver cannot be cast to TakesScreenshot, no screenshot will be taken
        3) It is possible for the screenshot to be blank
        4) There seems to be an issue with Firefox on certain platforms that prevents screenshots from being taken.
        Parameters:
        driver - - WebDriver that has the capability of TAKES_SCREENSHOT
        sFilename - - File name needs to be unique and have PNG extension
        Returns:
        true if successful else false

      • saveScreenshot

        public static boolean saveScreenshot(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Saves unique screenshot to following location with name: sScreenshotFolder + PathSeparator + sScreenshotPrefixName + nScreenshotCounter + ".png"

        Note:
        1) Must use this method if using Grid
        2) If driver cannot be cast to TakesScreenshot, no screenshot will be taken
        3) It is possible for the screenshot to be blank
        4) There seems to be an issue with Firefox on certain platforms that prevents screenshots from being taken.

        Example:
        saveScreenshot(driver) => c:\\temp\\screenshot001.png
        Parameters:
        driver - - WebDriver that has the capability of TAKES_SCREENSHOT
        Returns:
        true if successful else false
